channel.title: My dungeoneering won't give the reward after the final (9th boss)

item.title: My dungeoneering won't give the reward after the final (9th boss)
item.dc:creator: @loganownsyou loganownsyou
item.description:
@loganownsyou wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:528373”]So I’d like to know why you posted snippets, without any info on where you got that code from. Thanks.
That all looks like clicking buttons or firstclicknpc, which are not what you should be editing if you want stuff to be added on npc death.[/quote]

I definitely said this was from actionhandler.java, but anyhow i have a dungeoneering.java file that has basically the same thing in it so i wasn’t sure, i think i’ll just make them drop two keys and use those on a door or something. Thanks to the above guy!

Read full topic

item.title: My dungeoneering won't give the reward after the final (9th boss)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So I’d like to know why you posted snippets, without any info on where you got that code from. Thanks.
That all looks like clicking buttons or firstclicknpc, which are not what you should be editing if you want stuff to be added on npc death.

Read full topic

item.title: My dungeoneering won't give the reward after the final (9th boss)
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

This is probably most likely the wrong way to do this, but somewhere in the npchandler class “or something like” find the method that handles the npc deaths or drops and throw some bs in there. make sure it checks whether the npc was killed in a dungeoning instance and some other crap. gl

item.source: My dungeoneering won't give the reward after the final (9th boss)

item.title: My dungeoneering won't give the reward after the final (9th boss)
item.dc:creator: @loganownsyou loganownsyou
item.description:
@loganownsyou wrote:

My dungeoneering is perfect, except when i kill the final bosses (icy bones(ID: 10040) and chaos elemental(ID: 3200))
How do I add the reward of 5m and 100 dungeoneering points? Let me know if i need my dungeoneering class too.

Here is my code from the actionhandler class
I think case 7318: is it, but i don’t know if the other stuff is important. I don’t think it is but it can’t hurt.

[code] break;
case 8959:
if (c.getX() == 2490 && (c.getY() == 10146 || c.getY() == 10148)) {
if (c.getPA().checkForPlayer(2490, c.getY() == 10146 ? 10148 : 10146)) {
new Object(6951, c.objectX, c.objectY, c.heightLevel, 1, 10, 8959, 15);
}
}
break;

	case 2213:
	case 14367:
	case 11758:
	case 3193:
	case 11402:
	case 27663:
	case 26972:
	case 16700:
	case 4483:
		c.getPA().openUpBank();
	break;
	
	case 2996:

if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(989,1) && c.getItems().freeSlots() >= 1) {
c.getItems().deleteItem(989, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(c.getPA().randomCrystal(), 1);
c.getDH().sendDialogues(38, 945);
} else {
c.getDH().sendDialogues(37, 945); }
break;

				case 7318:
				if (!c.antispampush == true) {
			c.getPA().movePlayer(3012, 5235, c.playerId * 4);
			c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
			c.playerLevel[5] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]);
			c.getItems().addItem(391, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(143, 1);
			c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
			c.getPA().refreshSkill(5);
			c.hasFollower = 0;
			c.InDung = true;
			c.isSkulled = true;
			c.dungPoints += 50;
			c.DUfood4 += 5;
			c.getDungeoneering().spawnFinalWave1(c);

c.sendMessage("<shad=6081134>[Dungeoneering] <shad=15695415>50 Dungeoneering Tokens added!");
c.sendMessage("<shad=6081134>[Dungeoneering] <shad=15695415>If you manage to kill the bosses, you will receive 100 more!");
c.sendMessage("<shad=6081134>[Dungeoneering] <shad=15695415>If you relog, you will have to re-fight the bosses!");
c.antispampush = true;
c.juststarted = false;
}
break;

	case 10177:
		c.getPA().movePlayer(1890, 4407, 0);
	break;
	case 10230:
		c.getPA().movePlayer(2900, 4449, 0);
	break;
	case 10229:
		c.getPA().movePlayer(1912, 4367, 0);
	break;
	case 2623:
		if (c.absX >= c.objectX)
			c.getPA().walkTo(-1,0);
		else
			c.getPA().walkTo(1,0);
	break;
	case 451:
	case 450:
		c.sendMessage("There's no ore left on the rock.");
		break;[/code]

Thank you all in advance!!
